summary: Maurice Israel is mentioned in payroll records related to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). These records detail the names, positions, and salaries of committee staff. While the documents confirm his presence on the HSCA payroll, they do not provide specific details about his role, responsibilities, or involvement in the JFK assassination investigation. The documents are primarily administrative in nature, focusing on payroll certifications and related correspondence.
significance: The significance of Maurice Israel is limited to his presence on the HSCA payroll. Without further information, it is difficult to assess his specific contribution or role in the JFK assassination investigation. The documents suggest he was a staff member during the period covered by the payroll records.
